While slouching may seem more comfortable in the short term, it can have negative long-term effects on your body. Poor posture puts extra strain on your spine and muscles, which can lead to back and neck pain, headaches, and other issues. Over time, poor posture can even lead to degenerative changes in your spine, which can be painful and limit your mobility.

In contrast, maintaining good posture can help improve your balance and coordination, prevent falls, and reduce your risk of injury. Good posture can also improve your breathing and circulation, reduce stress on your joints, and help you maintain a healthy weight.

By making small changes to improve your posture, such as sitting up straight and engaging your core muscles, you can reap these benefits and improve your overall health and wellbeing. You may even find that good posture feels more comfortable and natural over time, as your body learns to support itself in a way that feels balanced and aligned.
